hello all: im a n00b, ive been trying to install a package manually, and i just can't seem to get it to work.
just stick with the Synaptic package manager until you feel more comfortable with the OS
you should consider the possibility you need more than a couple weeks experience with linux before you're ready to compile your own packages

frankly, if you're ready to out-smart Ubuntu with your own package management, then you're probably ready to look at another distribution that is more flexible to that sort of work.  Check out Gentoo - you will learn a great deal and it is a very solid distro
In all seriousness, if your intention is to learn Linux, then Gentoo is the best distro for that purpose.
Ubuntu is built in ways to shield you from learning linux.  And that's not a bad thing.
